definition[0]: a quantity of goods that are sent somewhere, especially in order to be sold
definition[1]: when someone sends or delivers something
definition[2]: a quantity of goods delivered at the same time
example[1]: Sixty eggs are removed from each consignment and tested for salmonella.
example[2]: A large consignment of weapons was unloaded from the ship.
definition[3]: goods given to someone acting for the owner, who must either sell them or return them to the owner
example[3]: Instead of selling him your goods, you can let him have them on consignment. This means he gets physical possession of the goods but you keep legal title.
